title: Software Support Lead Engineer
description:
The Role

Pixability brings a data-driven, scientific approach to video marketing. We are at the forefront of this revolution and use large-scale data analysis to make video content more compelling.

The support leader is a hands-on individual contributor who is willing to triage issues, answer customer questions, and resolve technical issues. You are excited to dive into existing code, data, and improve the results. You work with our product managers and engineers to improve our cloud-based video advertising products. You are a proven and trusted leader who inspires confidence across the entire organization. You excel at finding solutions to challenging technology problems, delighting customers with clear and complete communications, and you are excited to level up our ongoing support. You are relentlessly data-driven, customer-focused, and continuously searching for a better way through experimentation. You thrive in the midst of uncertainty and will find a path forward while guiding others along the way. You are a team builder who leads by example and celebrates when others succeed. You are a consensus builder who knows how to listen, make decisions, and adopt new ideas. Those around you regularly seek out your knowledge. You love exploring massive datasets to find new insights. You are comfortable being measured by the results. You can prioritize multiple deliverables in a fast-paced environment.

The Team

At Pixability, we build industry-leading products that create significant competitive advantages for our customers. Transparency, quality, urgency, and intellectual honesty are central tenets of our work ethics while embracing experimentation and collaboration to produce results that customers love.

Must Haves

  • Demonstrated hands-on ability to support all aspects of a cloud-based software organization
  • Superior communication skills including experience working directly with customer success, external customers, sales, product management, and engineering
  • Experience gathering support metrics and collaborating with the product managers to reduce ongoing support costs, improve the product, and eliminate support issues
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience managing all aspects of service level agreements
  • 3+ years of hands-on software development in at least one modern programming language, including Python
  • 3+ years of cloud computing experience working with production tools and frameworks such as Docker and AWS
  • 3+ years of SQL experience Experience with data pipelines, including stream processing with Kafka
  • 3+ years supporting a continuous integration and continuous delivery software startup environment Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science or related field Authorized to work in the US or Canada

Nice to Haves

  • Experienced in advertising or marketing technologies, such as Google Ads and YouTube
  • Snowflake experience
  • Looker experience
  • JIRA, Confluence experience
  • Machine learning experience, including Kubernetes
  • Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science or related field

Who We Are

Pixability is a video advertising software company that uses data science to optimize large, complex campaigns across YouTube and Connected TV. The company‚Äôs industry-leading optimization and insights solutions are independently verified by the YouTube Measurement Program, Oracle Data Cloud‚Äôs Moat Measurement, DoubleVerify, Integral Ad Science and other third parties. Pixability‚Äôs suite of solutions are used by the top media agencies and brands including Dentsu-Aegis, Havas, Interpublic Group, Omnicom, Publicis, and GroupM, as well as Swatch, Bose, KIND, L‚ÄôOr√©al, and Puma. For more information about Pixability, please visit www.pixability.com.

Our Award-Winning Culture

Our team is the heart of our culture. We value innovation, collaboration, and curiosity with a passion for getting things done. We strive to hire and cultivate the best employees and foster a culture of open communication and transparency. We are driven and hard-working, but also committed to having fun along the way with happy hours, team outings, and flexible paid time off. We‚Äôre proud to have been named the Global Leader in Video Innovation in the Google Premier Partner Awards (2017), as well as one of Boston's Best Places to Work by BostInno (2019), included in the BBJ Fast 50 for four consecutive years, and listed on the Inc. 5000 for six consecutive years.

title: Software Engineer Backend
description:
Deli Home supplies constructive and decorative DIY items and professional building materials. Thanks to the combined strength and knowledge of our companies and brands, we hold an important position within the market of our most important product groups: floor & stairs, wood, insect screens, doors and storage. Wood is the link between all these product groups and our further activities; wood is in our DNA!

The Deli Home umbrella includes brands such as CanDo, Bruynzeel, Lundia, Skantrae and Weekamp.

Since last year, Deli Home has acquired several companies including Numdata in the Netherlands and Unicon Creation in Czech Republic to deploy the Digital Carpenter strategy. Unicon Creation is located in Lacnov, Czech Republic, close to our production location for wooden windows, doors and frames. Both IT-companies Numdata and Unicon Creation form one organisation under the name Unicon Creation now and provide software development services for Deli Home. This software comprises an online platform that supplies 2/3D configurators for DIY chains and MES-systems for Made-2-Measure manufacturing at Deli Home owned production plants. The platform heavily interacts with other transactional systems like ERP, WMS and e-commerce-solutions.

The corporate values of Deli Home and Unicon Creation are ‚ÄúOpen, Reliable, Passionate and Enterprising‚Äù.

In connection with expansion of activities Unicon Creation is looking for an experienced

Software Engineer Backend

We have ambitious plans to expand and broaden our platform in the coming years. That is why we need reinforcement in our international team of software developers that operates autonomously as much as possible. Our future colleague will work within a SCRUM team.

  • As a backend developer you will develop business logic within our server applications (web application, web service, application, service).
  • You work together with front-end developers to unlock features in the front-end applications.
  • As a full stack developer you are also involved in data management, databases, scalability issues and cloud solutions.
  • You are involved in all phases of the development life cycle from design to deployment (devops).
  • You work together with software architects, external IT providers and subject matter experts of the business units.
  • You will be guided and supported in your introduction and personal development by experienced teammates with, among other things, in-depth domain knowledge and experience in deploying a wide range of applications. Of course the teammates are also very interested in your experience and fresh views.
  • You have a College or University background in computer science or related field.
  • In-depth knowledge of web applications, Java, SQL databases and virtualization. Systems like Docker and Kubernetes should be familiar territory or that you have already experimented with.
  • You know what it takes to write maintainable and testable code and have experience in continuous integration and deployment (CI / CD)
  • Good knowledge of the English language. We usually work together with business units and colleagues from the Netherlands where the working language is English.
  • You work in a modern and flexible (and friendly?) environment in close contact with users of the systems you develop. That also means that you sometimes go out and visit dealers and consumers. But also that you are in factories (eg in the Netherlands, the Czech Republic, Poland) that are controlled with our MES system.
  • We have an onboarding program to ensure that your colleagues and you, quickly become familiar with each other and that the team spirit is strengthened.

Our Technology Stack:

  • Java
  • ROM (DSL)
  • Apache/Tomcat
  • Linux
  • MariaDB
  • Haproxy

We offer:

  • 25 days of holiday + 3 sick days
  • Possibility to work from home (1 x a week) ‚Äì after trial period
  • Lunch allowance
  • New attractive offices in the center of Zlin
  • Travel compensation (who lives outside Zlin)
  • Insurance allowance
  • Free time activities allowance.
  • Flexible working time.
how_to_apply:
If you need additional information about the company or the job, please contact Frank Schepers, Managing Director of Numdata in the Netherlands (+31 6 53 28 49 46). Please send in your application with a motivation letter and Curriculum Vitae in English to our online application page.

Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.

title: senior front end developer
description:
Het Productiehuis van de Dienst ICT vertaalt de gewenste business functionaliteiten in robuuste en gecertificeerde ICT-oplossingen. Hierbinnen werken multidisciplinaire teams van ontwikkelaars, testers, analisten en beheerders continu aan het onderhoud en de doorontwikkeling van nieuwe en bestaande ICT-oplossingen. Kom jij ons versterken?

Locatie(s): Odijk

Organisatieonderdeel: Politiedienstencentrum

Vakgebied(en): ICT

Niveau: HBO

Wat ga je doen?

De politie streeft ernaar om, met de inzet van digitale middelen zoals de smartphone en tablet, plaatsonafhankelijk werken mogelijk te maken. We hebben daarvoor het programma Vernieuwend Registreren ingericht. Binnen dit programma valt onder andere de (door)-ontwikkeling van de MEOS‚Äìapp (Mobiel Effectiever Op Straat) en de applicatie Operationeel Politie Proces (OPP). Met de MEOS-app kunnen agenten snel en gemakkelijk via de smartphone een deel van het basispolitiewerk op straat afhandelen. Zo‚Äôn 40.000 agenten werken hier inmiddels mee. De ontwikkeling van de app wordt gedaan in samenwerking met agenten. De applicatie Operationeel Politie Proces (OPP) brengt nieuwe IV-producten voor de agenten tot stand.

Als senior front end developer werk je in multidisciplinaire teams aan de doorontwikkeling van zowel MEOS als OPP. In eerste instantie ligt je focus op de ombouw van AngularJS naar de laatste versie van Angular, hierbij ga je meewerken aan de nieuwe architectuur. Vervolgens maak je de overstap naar een OPP team, waarbij je focus zal liggen op het realiseren van functionaliteit ter verbetering van de huidige politieprocessen. Binnen OPP werken we met een op Angular ontwikkeld eigen framework. Je focust je of op het ontwikkelen van standaard componenten/bouwblokken voor de andere ontwikkelaars, of samen met de business functionaliteit voor de eindgebruiker realiseren (of een combinatie hiervan). Afhankelijk van je eigen voorkeur en de backlog wordt hier een keuze in gemaakt.

Je werkzaamheden bestaan met name uit:

  • de Product Owner ondersteunen bij het managen van de backlog
  • in samenwerking met de Architect vormgeven en verbeteren van de architectuur van MEOS bij de omzetting naar Angular;
  • nieuwe vragen en problemen inventariseren en inpassen in het bestaande landschap;
  • lifecycle management van het bestaande landschap;
  • een goede samenwerking opbouwen en onderhouden met andere productlijnen en business afdelingen;
  • ontwerpen maken die de optimale uitkomst weergeven van de te modelleren of te bouwen functionaliteit.

Zowel binnen MEOS en OPP wordt van je verwacht dat je open staat om binnen je eigen team werkzaamheden van een collega over te nemen (T-Shape).

Waar ga je werken?

Het Productiehuis van de Dienst ICT vertaalt de gewenste business functionaliteiten in robuuste en gecertificeerde ICT-oplossingen. Binnen dit Productiehuis zit in Odijk de DevOps-teams voor OPP en MEOS. Multidisciplinaire teams van developers, analisten en testers die continu werken via de Scrum/Agile methodiek aan snelle ontwikkeling, bouw en onderhoud van informatiesystemen en politieapplicaties. Cruciale producten voor het politiewerk op straat en in de opsporing. Zo werk je als gedreven IT-er aan een veiliger Nederland.

Wie ben jij?

Je hebt een hoog zelforganiserend vermogen en je werkt zelfstandig en effectief. Verder hecht je waarde aan teamwork en kun je met zowel technisch als niet- technische collega‚Äôs goed communiceren. Je weet overzicht te houden over de keten en hebt ervaring met het inrichten van processen.

Verder heb je:

  • een hbo diploma;
  • ruime kennis van en ervaring met Typescript, JavaScript en Angular2+;
  • ruime kennis van en ervaring met bouwen van apps op basis van HTML en CSS;
  • ervaring met geautomatiseerd testen tooling (zoals mocha, jasmine, protractor, cypress);

bij voorkeur:

  • ervaring met Knockout JS, AngularJS, Cordova;
  • ervaring met CI/CD, Jenkins, GIT, Bitbucket en Java/JEE;
  • ervaring met architectuurprincipes (design patterns, protocollen en dergelijke).

Wat wij bieden

De standplaats is Odijk. Er is ruimte voor 1 fte. Het betreft een functie voor 36 uur per week.

Omdat goede mensen belangrijk zijn binnen de politie investeren we in jouw toekomst. We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een vaste aanstelling, waarbij een proeftijd van √©√©n jaar van toepassing is.

Verder kun je het volgende van ons verwachten:

  • een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal ‚Ç¨ 2.866,- en maximaal ‚Ç¨ 4.624,- (schaal 10 Bbp) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek;
  • 8% vakantiegeld en 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering;
  • goede pensioenregeling en betaald ouderschapsverlof meer info over verlof, regelingen en mogelijkheden.

De formele functie binnen het functiegebouw van de politie is bedrijfsvoeringspecialist B werkterrein informatie- en communicatietechnologie.

Interesse?

Bel of mail met Manon Vos, ICT recruiter (06 -18 67 38 19 of manon.vos@politie.nl) als je meer informatie over de functie en/of de sollicitatieprocedure wilt hebben.

Wat verder belangrijk is

  • Een veiligheidsonderzoek maakt deel uit van de selectieprocedure.
  • Zonder IT'ers zijn we nergens. Ben jij expert in IT? Lees alles over o.a. data science, legaal hacken of cybersecurity en test je digitale skills in de Cybercrime challenge op it.kombijdepolitie.nl.
  • De politie zet in op vernieuwing en cultuurverschillen binnen teams. Divers samengestelde teams presteren beter. Daarom werken we hard aan een open en veilige cultuur waarin divers talent tot bloei komt.
how_to_apply: Solliciteer uiterlijk 30 november 2020 door hier op "solliciteer" te klikken.

title: Virtualization Infrastructure Architect (m/f/d) HCI
description:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

Join us in our mission to revolutionize the automation landscape. The automation solutions of Digital Industries shape the world around us - from the production of your next car to your mobile phone, our products can be found everywhere.

Who are we?

We are a newly formed startup within Siemens, striving to bring hyper-converged systems and IT data center efficiency to the shop floor. We built on our principles

  • Team empowerment ‚Äì drive decisions by ourselves with the best value for our customers Reflective improvement ‚Äì continuously check if we can do better
  • Supportive culture ‚Äì open culture of failure with everyone working to achieve our goals we want to expand and create a trustful and forward-thinking working environment.
  • Combined with our dedication and personal involvement we are more than just a team of employees. We are the creators of our own business.

The gap, we need you for:

  • You share your deep knowledge in IT technologies and hyper-converged infrastructures (HCI)
  • You think differently to combine your wide IT experience with our automation knowledge into disruptive products that blow our customers away
  • You drive and guide the specification and implementation of the software architecture
  • You actively design and contribute to our upcoming software stack including prototyping of new approaches and technologies Play a part in the selection and acquisition of new customers for Co-Creation
  • You manage architecturally relevant stakeholders on different levels up to the management within and outside Siemens
  • You take responsibility for architectural governance incl. survey and analysis of architectural metrics
  • You work self-sufficiently in a cross-functional team incl. coordination with system architects, other teams and first-time users

What we are looking for:

  • You live ownership culture and end-to-end responsibility with strong quality awareness
  • You have qualified education in HCI and virtualization architectures (e.g. OpenStack) or equivalent
  • You have solid and proven experience in designing cloud infrastructures in operations from clarification of requirements over defining the architecture to implementation
  • This is the perfect role if you are looking forward to applying your profound knowledge about IT and programming techniques as well as design principles and patterns
  • Based on excellent interpersonal skills you enjoy discussing and driving your ideas and designs with your team and management
  • You are hungry to explore the unknown and eager to tackle new challenges
  • You live and drive agile software development
  • You speak and write German and English fluently

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens. https://new.siemens.com/ - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens. FAQ - if you need further information on the application process. As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities. 09-Nov-2020

title: Front-end/React Engineer
description:
Who we are

Bryq is an assessment platform and our goal is to facilitate companies with their overall hiring process and enable them to find the best hires for them. Bryq offers a scientifically based assessment that combines the measurement of cognitive skills and personality traits. From an employer‚Äôs perspective, the results can help match the best candidates to the right job, as well as uncover potential superstars that may otherwise get overlooked in the hiring process. Candidates can identify their ideal career-path, increasing their chances of long-term job satisfaction. It‚Äôs a win-win solution for all.¬†

About the role

Bryq is growing and we are seeking to hire a skilled Senior Front-end/React Engineer to join our engineering team. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining multiple web applications, and implementing user interface components for multiple projects using React.js and Apollo GraphQL. You will also be responsible for profiling and improving front-end performance and documenting our front-end codebases.

This is a fully remote position.

Responsibilities

  • Design, architect, and implement multiple React web applications
  • Develop and maintain responsive user interface components
  • Write clean, performant, and well tested code
  • Work closely with the product team to clarify requirements and feasibility
  • Work closely¬† with the CTO to plan, estimate, and prioritize work, and to make technical decisions within the engineering team
  • Support technical screening of future engineering candidates
  • Participate in both sides of code reviews

Requirements

  • Advanced JavaScript (ES6+), HTML and CSS skills
  • Advanced experience with React
  • Thorough knowledge of build systems (Webpack) and JS toolchains (Babel)
  • Proficiency with various approaches to styling - from CSS, SASS and LESS to CSS-in-JS, and methodologies for organizing CSS
  • A strong belief and adherence to test driven development and continuous delivery (Jest, testing-library/react, Mocha, Selenium)
  • Experience with responsive HTML and CSS
  • Version control using git and continuous integration tools like Jenkins and Travis CI
  • Familiarity with design tools such as Sketch and Figma
  • Experience with developing complex software systems at scale with production quality deployment, monitoring and reliability
  • Understanding of Linux/Unix concepts
  • Driven and focused self-starter, great communicator, amazing follow-through‚Äîyou have a great work ethic and love the responsibility of being individually empowered

Bonus

  • Experience with GraphQL and Apollo Client in particular
  • Authentication mechanisms (OAuth, OpenID Connect) and associated concepts (JWT)
  • Experience with semantic HTML and web accessibility best practices and guidelines (WCAG)
  • Experience with cloud based platforms and technologies
  • Although you will primarily work on front-end, you should be familiar/curious with working across the stack

Why you should join us

Mission-driven: You'll be joining more than just another startup ‚Äî we are on a mission to improve HR decision making for both employers and employees around the world Impact: We move quickly and encourage every employee to push the envelope. Our best ideas come from out-of-the-box-thinking and innovation; be ready to fail fast and often! Compensation: We offer a competitive salary + meaningful equity based on merit Work/Life balance: we love our work, but we also love our lives. We are always mindful of maintaining each individual‚Äôs work/life balance Benefits + Perks: Flexible working hours, remote working arrangements, paid time off and exceptional family leave policies as just part of it; the health and happiness of our employees is foremost Provisions: ¬†We give you the tools you need to get your job done The opportunity at Bryq is huge - our customers today span the globe and range from tiny startups to multinational businesses. To date, Bryq has raised $2M and is backed by investors such as Persado‚Äôs founders Alex Vratskides and Guy Krief and VCs such as BigPi Ventures Bryq‚Äôs interviewing process¬†

Bryq is an equal opportunity employer; we take pride in fostering an Inclusive environment that attracts Diverse talent. We ask all candidates to complete the same objective and bias-free assessment, enabling us to screen candidates only on what matters for the role. The assessment can be completed online and requires around 20 minutes. Once completed, we will get in touch with you typically within 4-5 days to inform you about the next steps, if any. For more info regarding the assessment process please visit our website here.¬†

Bryq is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Lead Mobile Developer (m/f/x)
description:
YOUR MISSION

At HelloBetter, we strive to combine technology with the latest research in psychology, and other related health care fields to develop the most effective evidence-based digital mental health applications that can support thousands of patients in Germany and around the globe.

As Lead Mobile Developer (m/f/x) you are working at this challenging intersection between technology, UI and research to build mobile applications that change people‚Äôs lives for good. With your strong background in Mobile and React-Native, you are able to design and develop scalable mobile products that ensure a pixel-perfect, buttery smooth UI across different mobile platforms - all in all making our products user friendly, sticky and safe to use. You will be the key driver in shaping our mobile experience together with our experienced design team.

For more insights about our Tech and Hiring process, check out our Culture Guide

HelloBetter is a provider of medical products and we strive to follow not just regulations but the highest quality standards of our industry. Thus, you take pride in developing, complying and improving our internal QMS processes (ISO 13485) that make sure we always put the safety and wellbeing of our patients first.

YOUR OBJECTIVES

  • You are responsible for determining the structure and design of our mobile applications.
  • Build pixel-perfect, buttery smooth UIs across both mobile platforms.
  • Leverage native APIs for deep integrations with both platforms.
  • You ensure that design choices are determined by user experience.
  • Diagnose and fix bugs and bottlenecks for performance that feels native.
  • Reach out to the open-source community to encourage and help implement mission-critical software fixes‚ÄîReact Native moves fast and often breaks things.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.

YOUR PROFIL

Must-Have

  • 5+ years of experience with mobile application development from planning to publishing.
  • 3+ years of experience and proficiency in React-Native and MST/Redux.
  • Experience leading a team.
  • Strong understanding of Realm database and its usability with React-Native.
  • Understanding of key design principles and ability to write well-documented, clean Javascript code.
  • Experience in TypeScript.
  • Rock-solid at working with third-party dependencies and debugging dependency conflicts.
  • Understanding of REST APIs, the document request model, and offline storage.
  • Experience with Git, continuous integration and test automation.
  • Experience with Jira, Confluence, Github and similar tools.
  • Knowledge of security best practices and understanding the most common security vulnerabilities

Nice To Have

  • Experience in Node.js.
  • University Degree in Computer Science.
  • Experience with Quality Management Systems (ISO 13485) for medical products from working in similar roles in health care technology companies.
  • Experience with graphic design applications such as Figma and other tools like Zeplin.
  • Familiarity with native build tools, like XCode, Gradle (Android Studio, IntelliJ).

WHY US?

  • We support you in your role with an exclusive and comprehensive Leadership Experience package including 1:1 coaching and leadership training to develop you as a Lead.
  • We help 100s of people daily who suffer from Depression, Stress, Insomnia, Burnout, Alcoholism...
  • We are genuinely at the innovation forefront of developing applications for a multitude of mental health disorders.
  • We are not just digitising existing mental health therapies, we develop new innovative programs that do not yet exist at all.
  • We nurture our people and pay a lot of attention to personal growth. We can proudly say that we have some of the best experts in the field and have a really high quality of what we do in research and operations.
  • We have a very unique product with the world‚Äôs strongest evidence-base.
  • We are operating in one of the most interesting new markets where we have the opportunity to change the lives of many people.
  • Lot‚Äôs of autonomy and ownership ahead of micro-management.
  • We are purpose-driven, pragmatic and honest.
  • We love data.
  • We are community players taking care of each other and also like to hang out outside of working hours.

Benefits

  • Amazing roof-top office in the centre of Berlin close to Hackescher Markt and fantastic atmosphere (for once we are back in the office!).
  • Flexible working hours and home-office friendly (well, fully home office right now). We are a delivery-oriented company and don‚Äôt judge people by the hour.
  • Competitive salary and attractive employee stock option plan.
  • Unlimited working contract.
  • Various opportunities for growth with your own 1.000 Euro annual training budget.
  • Daily breakfast, fresh fruits & vegetables (during Covid-19 we only have cereals), coffee & drinks provided.
  • Subsidised Gym subscription with Urban Sports Club - 30 Euros sponsored by us.
  • Free language courses and regular team events including cool offsites.
  • Tax-deductible pension plan with an attractive employer‚Äôs contribution.
  • Free choice between Apple (e.g. Macbook Pro 13/15‚Äù) or Windows/Linux Hardware (e.g. Lenovo ThinkPad T490s, 14", Core i7, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD).

ABOUT US HelloBetter was founded under the name GET.ON Institut by internationally renowned researchers and psychologists in 2015. In over 35 randomized controlled trials HelloBetter has developed and evaluated 11 trainings from eight specific problem areas in cooperation with Leuphana University, Friedrich-Alexander-University Erlangen-Nuremberg, Free University Amsterdam, Harvard University and other partners.

The work of the expert team has been published in international journals (e.g. The Journal of the American Medical Association) and has been honoured with various awards (e.g. Wilhelm Exner Prize in Psychology 2016, EFPA Comenius Prize 2017, Digital Health Prize 2018, EU Compass Good Practice 2018 in Mental Health).

Check out our Culture Guide
how_to_apply:
Submit your application via this link: https://geton-jobs.personio.de/job/274480?_pc=256118#apply

We are looking forward to receiving your application! :)

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
Senior Full Stack Developer

Who we are SIG is an ambitious global technology and consultancy firm delivering independent software quality assurance solutions. We believe we can make the world a better place by helping developers and organisations create better software. To accomplish this, our Software Development Team is continuously improving and expanding Sigrid, our Software Assurance Platform. This is no small task: we are adding new analysis capabilities; we are growing and developing our frontends to become more intuitive, integrated and feature-rich; we are preparing our backend to scale and handle more code, faster.

How we work As you might expect, we hold quality in high regard: we measure the quality of our code our process and our operations, more than you might be used to. We code, write tests, review, discuss and refactor if needed. We don‚Äôt just spit out features and move on to the next thing. We automate things wherever we can and throw out stuff we no longer need. In the long run, quality equals speed. Some data you may be interested in: we have a Java backend, Angular/Typescript frontend. Our pipeline starts in Gitlab which produces docker containers handled by Nexus deployed on a Puppet-managed cloud infrastructure.

Where you come in We are looking to grow our team at a steady pace. What we do is pretty high end, so we can‚Äôt and won‚Äôt hire people in bulk. You‚Äôll quickly find yourself responsible for significant chunks of our landscape. Our consultants are heavy users of our software. They are close by, and you‚Äôll be working with them to get things right. You'll be doing some proper engineering, ranging from finding and solving performance bottlenecks to exploring new tools and technologies. And, once you're on to something, you'll talk about it in one of our frequent knowledge sessions.

What's in it for you? You'll work on the software that runs our business, so what you do makes a difference. You'll work in a modern environment with modern technologies, and you'll work with great colleagues in a diverse team. Through our process and coding standards, you will become an even better coder than you are today. There's plenty of opportunities to educate yourself through online training, attending conferences and trying out new stuff during our annual hackathon. On a lighter note, we have weekly Friday get-togethers to provide some desirable distraction. In general, you have a lot of control over your schedule as long as you get the job done.

Requirements

  • MSc in technical field.
  • Several years of experience as a software developer in Java, Angular or comparable technologies.
  • Experience with managing cloud computing resources is a plus.
  • Experience with IT operations is a plus.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Strong affinity with software intensive systems.
  • Excellent command of the English language, Dutch is a plus.
  • Strong analytical skills and able to draw relevant conclusions.

Interested? Apply via the application button.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

title: Lead Frontend Engineer/Web Developer
description:
We're building a Google Sheets replacement. This is the next generation spreadsheet - with (i) more power than Excel, (ii) better collaboration than Google Sheets, (iii) great experience on both web, desktop, and mobile, (iv) as well as several additional powers that users will be excited about. This will be a very engineering-heavy and design-heavy product. Not just another CRUD app.

The Frontend Engineer/Web Developer role will help lead the frontend team. You have to care about beautiful and fast frontend products as this is the cornerstone for this project. Example of an interesting frontend challenge: implementing a snappy grid-based rendering of information that can scale to fluidly displaying and manipulating thousands of data points - text labels, numbers, charts e.t.c.

Tech Stack

  • TypeScript (JavaScript)
  • Interaction with computation-heavy code written in Rust through WebAssembly (Frontend engineers themselves don't need to know Rust, but are of course welcome to learn/contribute to that part of the code base if they want)
  • Interaction with backend via WebSockets
  • React for all of the UI except for the grid rendering - up to the frontend team to decide whether to use it or not.

Experience

  • 5+ years experience working on projects with a complex frontend. Even better if the frontend involved allowing users to manipulate rich content on the web page (e.g. edit documents, draw/manipulate images/animations)
  • Strong knowledge of JavaScript (and/or TypeScript)
  • Desire for and experience of crafting beautiful frontend experiences
  • Experience with WebAssembly is not necessary and is not required, but can act as one of many indicators that the person has worked on some interesting frontend challenges.

More details and current team composition can be discussed when we find a time to chat. Team is currently ex Uber, ex Google, ex Netflix. Company has already secured seed round fundraising.

This is a full-time role that can be remote worldwide.

title: Go Engineer
description:
Aiva, the Amazon- and Google-funded leader in voice-powered healthcare, is looking for a Go Engineer with an interest in learning new and exciting frameworks to help us continue our rapid growth. Job Description (tl;dr: UNIXy OSes, Google Cloud, AWS, Go, Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, PostgreSQL, Redis, JavaScript/TypeScript, gRPC, and GraphQL.)

At Aiva, we create platforms to empower healthcare organizations. To do so, we research and choose the best technologies that we can find, and our core engineering team builds and maintains systems based on those technologies.

We're looking for a teammate who loves to create and maintain such software platforms, someone who enjoys working with a wide variety of programming languages, operating systems, toolkits, and cloud platforms. As that teammate, you will be expected to have a keen eye for small details, an ability to dive deeply into many different technologies, and a genuine interest in taking on responsibilities from every part of the software development stack. We're looking for someone who is truly interested in the practice of modern computing, from coding to Kubernetes. In addition to technical competence, the teammate we seek is someone who is firmly aligned with our master values. All core engineers at Aiva must be comfortable as not only students, but also as teachers; and, above all, skillful communicators.

Responsibilities: -Engaging closely with Aiva leaders to understand product direction

-Implementing new features and enhancing existing ones using agreed-upon strategies

-Mastering the features offered by the Aiva platform itself

-Building tailored solutions for customers using features offered by the Aiva platform

-Coordinating with other teams within Aiva in order to create the best solutions possible

-Staying up-to-date on the latest innovations within the voice assistant ecosystem, and sharing that knowledge with the team

-Evaluating new tech, and determining whether it might benefit our end-user experiences and development efficiency

Core Skills & Experience: -Experience with the command line, code versioning tools (git), and other technical essentials

-Experience with these technologies or similar ones: UNIXy OSes, Google Cloud, AWS, Go, Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, PostgreSQL, Redis, JavaScript/TypeScript, gRPC, and GraphQL.

-Ability to collaborate and coordinate with different teams in order to develop solutions

Ability to understand business requirements and turn them into working technical solutions

About Us Aiva is the voice operating system for better care. We use Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant and other voice assistants to empower patients and seniors throughout their care journey. They enjoy more entertainment options, better control of their environment and closer communication with their care team. For example, when you tell Aiva what you want, she understands and routes your request to the most appropriate caregiver, who uses our proprietary mobile app to triage and respond to requests in their own voice.

Aiva is based in Los Angeles. Hospital clients include Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, and post-acute clients include Amica Senior Lifestyles. Aiva investors include the Google Assistant Investments Program, the Alexa Fund, Act One Ventures, Mucker Capital and the Cedars-Sinai Accelerator. We are growing quickly and looking to expand our team. Some folks work remotely, and we're open to candidates for this position who don't live in LA.
how_to_apply: If this sounds like you, please send your resume or LinkedIn profile to careers@aivahealth.com.

title: Senior Javascript Developer (Sydney or remote anywhere in Australia)
description:
Times have changed. We've moved to a hybrid model of working. That means we‚Äôre now open to applicants from anywhere in Australia! You can work from our office or work remotely - your choice.

Benefits

  • Highly skilled, senior and friendly team;
  • Great clients + interesting work;
  • Learning Budget of $2,000 plus two days of personal development every year;
  • We‚Äôll also chip in for your Internet and phone with our Communications Allowance and contribute towards keeping your laptop up to date!
  • Employee Stock Ownership Plan. That‚Äôs right, everyone that works for Airteam has the opportunity to own part of the company!

Essential skills for this role

  1. 5+ years of solid JavaScript experience; you must be comfortable with React, Node and modern JavaScript.
  2. Experience with AWS - AWS certifications highly regarded.
  3. You are a self-starter and can work within a team to ship high-quality code
  4. You are an excellent communicator, written and verbal
  5. You have experience communicating with clients

This role is right for you if

You love to code; you‚Äôre the kind of person who loves to learn new things. You enjoy solving problems and crafting elegant solutions. You like to work autonomously, but as part of a team. You can choose the best methods to get things done with a focus on maintainable code. Your experience includes other languages or tech stacks. You enjoy working somewhere that gives you respect and fosters good relationships with clients and colleagues.

Our hiring process

  1. Fill in the application form and include your CV. We are looking for examples of how you meet the essential skills we have outlined for the role. We love getting cover letters introducing yourself!
  2. We review all applications. If we see a skills/experience match, we'll give you a call.
  3. Then we'll move onto an interview stage to talk about what you can bring to the team. You'll get a chance to ask us lots of questions too!

About Airteam

We're a small team of experienced developers and designers creating brand new software for the world to use. We are makers and problem solvers, we are known for our ability to ship high-quality digital products. Our clients include fintech, financial services, insurance, education, healthcare and government.

We're looking for people who üíô love what they do, enjoy a challenge, are happy to jump in and get things done and strive for better outcomes for our clients.

Important information üëá

Unfortunately, we cannot offer sponsorship for this position. Applicants must be in Australia and eligible to work.

We are an equal opportunity employer and consider all applicants including people of different ages, gender, ethnicity, physical ability, sexual orientation, religious belief, work experience, educational background. We prefer not to work with recruiters.

We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes sent from recruiters. Thanks!

description:

title: Java Software Developer - Core Team
description:
As Java Software Developer, you work closely with our game teams to shape the foundation of our next big hits and contribute as a productive member of an agile development team in all phases of the development lifecycle.

Your mission:

  • Develop features shared across our game backends
  • Improve performance-critical components, increase the robustness and scalability of our software
  • Improve our libraries and backend services with your knowledge of software architecture and high-quality code
  • Maintain and extend our development tools and environment

Your profile:

  • Degree in Computer Sciences, Business Information Systems or equivalent training and experience as IT specialist
  • Several years of experience in object-oriented programming in Java with Spring Boot and optimally the Akka framework
  • Software development with Spring, the UNIX command line and profound knowledge of SQL, GIT, and Continuous Delivery
  • You love to dive deep into other people‚Äôs code which is reflected in your Github profile
  • Solid experience in using various methods in software design and a strong belief in automated testing to guarantee and improve code quality in compliance with the company standards
  • Being a backend geek, you also like to switch to the frontend side with Angular, C# and Unity
  • Good English language and overall communication skills
  • Proactive and motivated individual with a willingness to learn

Why join us?

  • Be part of a great international team in a healthy and stable-growing company
  • Your working device will be the latest MacBook Pro with high-end hardware
  • We actively support your further development and give you all the needed resources to evaluate new technologies and participate in open source communities
  • We provide additional training budget to spend on attending conferences, taking hard skill courses or improve your soft skills as well as purchasing books
  • Our career model is set up equally for an expert in a technical career or a management path
  • Use opportunities to make your code open source and show your achievements at international conferences
  • We offer competitive compensation with benefits like relocation support, company gym, smartphone or tablet, company bikes, rooftop terrace with BBQ and much more

Excited to start your journey with InnoGames and join our dynamic team as a Java Software Developer? We look forward to receiving your application as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible start date through our online application form. Cristal Ledesma would be happy to answer any questions you may have.

Apply and #stayhome! Due to the coronavirus outbreak, we switched our operations company-wide to home office and turned our hiring process into a fully virtual one. When hiring, we are also open for our new team members starting their work remotely at the time being or adjusting contract start dates accordingly. Stay home and safe!

InnoGames is Germany‚Äôs leading developer and publisher of mobile and online games. The company based in Hamburg is best known for Forge of Empires, Elvenar and Tribal Wars. InnoGames‚Äô complete portfolio encompasses seven live games and several mobile titles in production.

Born as a hobby, InnoGames today has a team of 400 employees from more than 30 nations who share the passion of creating unique games that players across the globe enjoy for years. In order to further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
Here at Playco, we make games that bring the world closer together through play.

As a Full Stack Engineer at Playco, you will play a pivotal role in creating a platform to revolutionize the instant games development industry. Our engineers are generally amazing at something and great at everything else. We write scalable backend systems, cross-compilers, JavaScript / TypeScript game APIs and tools, and whatever else it takes. No matter what you work on each day, you will work with the best engineers in the world; we have top talent in every part of our stack.

The Role

  • Be responsible for designing, developing and deploying major game features.
  • Own game feature areas from end-¬≠to¬≠-end.
  • Be the champion for the user!
  • Insist on the highest standards and create functional and engaging features that will delight our users.
  • Be part of a tight game development team looking to iterate fast on a fun concept and then building it out.
  • Have real input on end-user product.
  • Be a key member of a high performing software engineering team.
  • Collaborate with design, engineering and production teams to devise optimal engineering solutions to game requirements.
  • Hands¬≠ on architect and coder for sophisticated client/server systems for mobile gaming.
  • Innovate and iterate on process, systems and technology to deliver world¬≠-class social games.
  • Be a leader; Identify and articulate technical and production risks and obstacles, as well as generate solutions!

Desired Skills

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience.
  • 3+ years of professional software engineering experience.
  • Experience writing clean, testable, high-quality code and designing highly scalable systems in production.
  • Capable of JavaScript + HTML5 to create custom, interactive, user experiences that are enjoyable on all HTML5 browsers.
  • Proficient at using script debuggers like Chrome Debugger.
  • Solid familiarity with deployment on cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.).
  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals in object¬≠-oriented design, algorithms, and data structures.
  • Advanced software engineering skills, including the ability to write maintainable and robust code in a popular object oriented language.
  • Solid familiarity with analytics and A/B testing in mobile games.
  • Familiarity with git, svn or other VCS.
  • Self starter, analytical and creative.
  • Strong team player with a positive attitude.
  • Good communication skills and the ability to work effectively on shared projects with designers, artists, testers, product managers and other developers.

Bonus

  • Expert knowledge of NodeJS and ES6 / TypeScript.
  • DevOps experience -- setting up CI/CD environments, orchestrating deployments, creating monitoring dashboards, anything that makes the development process easier, more enjoyable and more accountable.
  • Experience in game development and shipped titles.

title: Full-Stack Application Developer
description:
Exciting new opportunity to lead the development of a consumer and product oriented application to MVP stage and beyond

Contract opportunity, starting ASAP

We are a new and exciting startup based in Melbourne seeking an experienced Full Stack Application developer to come in at the start of the project and take on full responsibility as our sole developer. You must be entirely comfortable being the only developer on the project as you will be responsible for making some crucial architectural decisions as well as building the whole product from start to finish. We need a well-rounded developer who loves to take on the challenge of taking a new product idea from concept to mvp whilst also being able to work under tight deadlines.

As a developer you should specialise in mobile apps, but also be comfortable standing up all the essentials from scratch using cloud services and best practices, (devops, auth, db, api).

Reporting to the business owner and tech advisors you will have a range of responsibilities from shaping and implementing our new application to ensuring that we stay on the leading edge of technology.

The successful candidate will have experience with similar technologies;

  • Extensive experience as a Full Stack Development
  • One or more iOS/Android frameworks: Xamarin, Blazor, Flutter, React.
  • Experience with test automation
  • Experience with hosting and devops, Azure or AWS
  • Extensive knowledge of software engineering practices and methodologies, i.e. agile,
  • Experience with JSON Schema and validation processes
  • Strong stakeholder management and communication skills with non-technical individuals
  • Strong understanding of continuous integration and continuous deployment
  • Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills

Highly desirable:

  • Experience with Amazon and Facebook oriented APIs and processes
  • Familiarity with calendar and SMS integration
  • Familiarity with document oriented databasing (eg Mongo DB)

To be successful you should be passionate about application and web technology, staying abreast of the latest innovations in the industry and be able to articulate your understanding of technology. key attributes we are looking for are the ability to work autonomously and coming in with fresh ideas This is a great opportunity for someone to come in on the ground floor and shape the future of our mobile application.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
ResoluteAI is a fast-growth data aggregation and intelligent search startup, with a mission to enable scientifically driven organizations to make their next big discovery. Our tools allow our clients to find relevant results in an efficient manner, across patents, clinical trials, publications, drug and medical device datasets, and within their own internal corporate documents (enterprise search). We accomplish this through our proprietary machine learning algorithms. We are proud to count amongst our clients two of the top four (and five of the top twelve) global pharmaceutical firms by market cap.

We are looking for full-stack developers to help build out our capabilities as we continue to grow.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Integrate public domain datasets into the search platform using our ETL framework.
  • Design and implement new features that integrate and highlight the various public datasets.
  • Work with various external enterprise search APIs to ingest and enrich clients‚Äô documents for search.
  • Assist machine learning engineers with deploying their models into production
  • Communicate directly with clients on requirements, progress, and setting expectations.
  • Assist with bug fixes and writing of regression and unit tests.

Education and Previous Experience:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience in software development
  • 5+ years in related experience and training

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Strongly skilled in Python. Experience with SQL and an ORM (e.g. sqlalchemy).
  • Can hold your own on the frontend UI in ReactJS
  • Comfortable working with Docker and in a Linux environment
  • Experience with ElasticSearch ‚Äì very strong plus
  • Experience with Elastic Map Reduce or Spark is a plus
  • Knowledge of networking, especially AWS services and infrastructure is a plus
  • Must have a self-starter mentality and willingness to dig deep into the code.
  • Ability to own your work and adopt an outcomes-based approach, in a fast paced environment of quickly evolving requirements.

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Full benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, Commuter benefit)
  • 401(k) and matching
  • Equity in the company
  • Unlimited Paid Time Off
  • Flexible Work Environment

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
We offer

  • Being part in establishing sigo as the biggest e-cargobike sharing company
  • The unique opportunity to shape a company
  • ‚Ä¶ and accelerate the transition to new mobility solutions!

Your responsibilities

Your profile

how_to_apply: We're looking forward to your application! Please send it as an email along with your CV, your desired salary and your earliest start date to Florian Oefner (jobs@sigo.green).

title: Data Quality Engineer
description:
Quick Take: Axios is a growth-stage startup dedicated to providing trustworthy, award-winning news content in an audience-first format. We're hiring a Data Quality Engineer!

Why it Matters: The quality team‚Äôs mission at Axios will be to ensure our technology is of the highest quality for our readers and clients every day. In this role you will be collaborating with multi-functional teams such as the data engineering, data science and product teams to test, validate and monitor data platforms and the data flowing through them. The quality team will integrate tightly into our cross-functional product teams to refine requirements for our products and to ensure the systems delivered line up.

The Details: The Data Quality Engineer‚Äôs responsibility is to ensure Axios is shipping better products consistently. Responsibilities of this role include:

Collaborating with technical leads, data engineers, analysts, product managers and assigned squad to define and refine requirements Leading the squad‚Äôs efforts in identifying risk and developing mitigation strategies Developing methods for managing and maintaining data integrity across systems Writing and executing test plans, utilizing both manual and automated testing techniques Managing bugs, including identification, logging, tracking and triaging Working with data engineering squad to prioritize and develop data qualification pipeline, qualification criteria, identify testing gaps, and deliver measurable test results Identifying the need for and improving processes, tools and testing¬†

Go Deeper: Ideal candidates will embody an entrepreneurial spirit, a passion for Axios‚Äô mission and have the following skills:

Experience detecting and reporting data quality issues Experience in Software Quality Assurance, Quality Engineering, or as a SDET Experience working with data pipeline/pipeline issues Familiarity with Kafka, PySpark, Jenkins/Circle, AWS Experience testing services and web applications Willingness to be a problem solver and produce results in a fast paced environment Experience working with Ruby, Python, Node and/or Javascript is preferred Practical experience with SQL and NoSQL databases The ability to set up test environments, deploy code, use the command line Experience testing in an Agile and Continuous Integration environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills Exceptionally collaborative with obsessive attention to detail

Don‚Äôt forget:

Competitive salary Health insurance (100% paid for individuals, 75% for families) Primary caregiver 12-week paid leave 401K Generous vacation policy, plus company holidays Company equity Commuter and cell phone benefit A commitment to an open, inclusive, and diverse work culture Annual learning and development stipend

Additional pandemic-related benefits:

One mental health day per month $100 monthly work-from-home stipend Tele-mental health services¬† OneMedical membership, including tele-health services¬† Increased work flexibility for parents and caretakers¬† Access to the Axios ‚ÄúFamily Fund‚Äù, which was created to allow employees to request financial support when facing financial hardship or emergencies¬† Weekly company-sponsored exercise and meditation classes¬† Virtual company-sponsored social events

title: Full Stack Engineer (Ruby, Angular 2+)
description:
Experience: Tech Lead Level

Hello! Are you ready to Work from Home and transform your career?

We're looking for a Full Stack Engineer to join the engineering team at Modus. Want to help our clients build awesome solutions to accomplish their goals and vision? Are you interested in working from home with some of the best talent on the planet? Then keep reading.

About You

You love building great software. Your work could be supporting new feature development, migrating existing features, or creating APIs. You'll have a primary focus on backend development, though may need to jump into the frontend from time to time.

Our client‚Äôs tech stack is Ruby for the Back end, Javascript for the Front end and AWS for deployment. We use modern tools, which means you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with technologies like Webpack, Redux, Apollo, Styled Components, AWS and other cloud platforms, and much more.

You have worked with teams before on large and demonstrable projects.

You bring strong experience on the backend development in Ruby, utilizing Ruby on Rails, Angular 2+ as a framework and GraphQL. You have a strong grasp of HTML5, CSS and JavaScript. First hand experience working with Ruby on Rails is a must. And you bring experience using iterative and incremental methods and TDD and/or BDD.

You bring knowledge working with MySQL, Postgres, or MSSQL. You understand Agile software development and DevOps practices, and can work closely with QA teams to optimize your code.

You relish creating high quality code from the comfort of your own home. Your engineering projects will focus on understanding customers' needs and translating those needs from product specifications into functional, production ready code. You'll have the opportunity to ship code daily that will be used by customers.

You love learning. Engineering is an ever-evolving world. You enjoy playing with new tech and exploring areas that you might not have experience with yet. You are self-driven, self-learner willing to share knowledge and participate actively in your community.

Having overlap with your team is critical when working in a global remote team. Modus requires all team members to overlap with EST morning hours daily. In addition, reliable high speed internet is a must.

Things You Might Do

Modus is a fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:

  • Give back to the community via open source and blog posts
  • Travel and meet great people- as part of our remote-first lifestyle, it's important that we come together as needed to work together, meet each other in person and have fun together. Please keep that in mind when you apply.
  • Teach and be taught: Modus creates active teams that work in internal and external projects together, giving opportunities to stay relevant with the latest technologies and learning from experts worldwide
  • Interact directly with internal and external clients to represent Modus and its values

Why Modus Create:

Our Benefits may vary according to the Country you are located in, so please reach out to our recruiter in case you have any questions.

If you become a contractor we offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • 100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)
  • Travel according to client's needs
  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

Do you have what it takes? Apply today!

About Modus

Modus Create is a digital product agency that accelerates digital transformation. We use high performing small teams, emerging technology, and ‚Äúnew school‚Äù product development tools and methods to accelerate business outcomes. We support our clients across four core delivery areas: business and product strategy consulting, customer experience, cloud services, and Agile software delivery.

Driven by a team of world-class talent, we have been recognized by the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing private companies 5 years in a row, the Washington Business Journal list of Fastest Growing Companies in the Washington, DC area two years in a row, and a top company for remote work by FlexJobs. We‚Äôre also an official partner to Atlassian, AWS, Cloudflare, GitHub, InVision, Ionic Framework, and Vue.js!

Based on the model of an open source team, Modites work remotely, and are located across the globe. That‚Äôs allowed us to hire the best talent in the world, no matter where they live. Our highly collaborative, autonomous, and effective working environment is fueled by a team unified by a love of continuous learning. Our years of thought leadership including books, whitepapers, blog posts, conference and MeetUp talks, demonstrate our commitment to sharing what we‚Äôve learned.

We encourage every Modus employee to do the same. Our company is a platform for the growth of our employees. Through working with our distributed team of experts on challenging projects, every person that joins the Modus team can expect to continue growing and learning every day. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

title: Medior Software Engineer
description:
Software Engineer

Code crunching space traveler

How do you make our customers happy?

With 10 million customers, 30 million monthly visits and about 16 million products on display, bol.com is the most successful online retail platform in The Netherlands and Belgium. And when we say ‚Äòplatform‚Äô, we mean it. Well over 23,500 external partners ‚Äì and counting ‚Äì enrich the product base. Data-driven, adventurous (making mistakes is no biggie, as long as learnings are shared), we intend to deliver on our promise to make life easier and more fun for customers. And that is exactly what our 500 IT professionals (25% internationals), who comprise 90+ autonomous Scrum teams, do.

The biggest challenge

Although our business model may sound familiar, our approach to network retailing sets us apart from the usual suspects. So much so, in fact, that while we admire the achievements of international platforms, we don‚Äôt necessarily consider them our peers. We opt for a more localized approach (up close and personal!) and our ways of working reflect our idiosyncratic DNA. At bol.com, it‚Äôs all about autonomy and taking ownership, so end-to-end responsibility is the norm. Can you shoulder that?

Your responsibilities as a Software Engineer

  • Develop clean, high-performance code that facilitates and inspires over 10 million customers, 23k partners, and almost 2.000 colleagues
  • Think of ways to make solutions scalable and future-proof
  • Help your team grow and team up with business stakeholders to ensure that solutions add customer value
  • Take full, end-to-end ownership over team solutions
  • Experiment with cutting-edge tooling ‚Äì including tooling you add to the stack

As Software Engineer, you will join one of our Scrum teams. We believe in ownership, and you will have a mandate (together with your team) to develop features end-to-end. At bol.com, we are big on autonomy, and that makes us strong: we expect you to make all (technical) choices along the way but also to assume ownership when things go awry. You build it ‚Äì you run it ‚Äì you love it is our mantra, and we live it every day. Every Scrum team is part of a Fleet ‚Äì every Fleet part of a Space.

As for your GPS location within the bol.com universe, check out which one you may call your (temporary, because moving between spaces is possible) home.

Check out our spaces

No matter the space you‚Äôll join, your tech stack includes:

  • Java (8 or higher)
  • Kotlin
  • GO
  • Google Cloud stack

3 reasons why this is(n‚Äôt) for you

  • Yes, because you take pride in writing high quality code, and are versed in Java and (some of)
  • Yes, because you‚Äôre a true pioneer, both when it comes to coding and tooling
  • Yes, because you want to team up with a market leader that feels like a scaleup
  • Not, because business concerns don‚Äôt concern you #letthemeatcode
  • Not, because you don‚Äôt believe the land of ‚Äòweed, windmills and wooden shoes‚Äô has much to offer to techies
  • Not, because you want to be taken by the hand; autonomy & ownership are not your thing

Where you‚Äôll work

As Software Engineer, you‚Äôll join a Scrum team you can always rely on for feedback and continuous professional growth. The setting? Think ‚Äòcampus‚Äô, including a game room and soccer field. Despite our size, we make fun of rigid rules and traditional work structures. We may be a market leader, but you won‚Äôt get a whiff of the corporate odor you associate with that. Our strength derives from working together as equals and constantly improving each other. After all, you can accomplish great things on your own, but so much more with your colleagues! Given that over 25% of our IT fleet consists of internationals ‚Äì if you want the receipe for a celebratory Brazilian feijoada or want to sample authentic Greek mezze, Utrecht is the place to be ‚Äì we have a lot of relocation experience. As for our ways of working, check out the videos. For info on current challenges (yep, we share code), check out our Techlab!

Also, do check the Techlab for our latest IT-blogs, including current challenges!

What you get

Daily treats

With good food, you get happy bol.commers. That's why we make sure there are a lot of lunch possibilities, if you want a quick bite, a snack or a healthy salad.

Money and more...

Working at bol.com is challenging and therefore you get something in return. Besides salary, you will receive a yearly bonus, holiday allowance, holiday entitlement of 29 days, travel allowance, group insurance and more.
how_to_apply:
Apply right away

Are you our next cruncher of crispy code?

Apply now by clicking here on apply

title: Senior DevOps Developer
description:
About the Role: At Plotly, our customers depend on us for their mission-critical data analysis needs. In this DevOps Engineer role, you'll work with code, colleagues, and customers to build Plotly's core products and improve their robustness and scalability.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Architect and develop the core functionality of Plotly's enterprise products, with a particular focus on Dash application management capabilities (similar to Heroku)
  • Lead efforts to improve reliability, testing, automation, observability, and performance throughout our stack
  • Tackle big problems as we work to scale Dash Enterprise to more demanding customer requirements in diverse cloud and physical environments
  • Identify and advocate for product, documentation, and engineering quality improvements

Requirements Technical skills (these periods may overlap):

  • 6 years or more of experience writing code as part of your job (in any language)
  • 5 years or more of Linux systems administration and generalist networking experience
  • 3 years or more of experience with Python and Git
  • 1 year or more of experience with backend web application development
  • Proficient with Docker
  • Some past experience with one or more of reliability, testing, automation, observability, and performance work
  • Preferred: Some familiarity with any of LDAP, SAML, Windows enterprise systems administration, Flask, Django, public cloud environments, and/or Kubernetes
  • Preferred: prior technical leadership experience

Professional requirements:

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Able to follow and produce documentation instructions
  • Ability to debug, troubleshoot, and seek answers autonomously before asking colleagues for help
  • Can drive the full architecture and development cycle of large feature improvements or refactorings
  • Able to mentor and supervise junior and intermediate colleagues
  • Collaborative within the team and across the whole company

Assets

  • Frontend programming experience (Javascript, CSS, React or Vue)
  • Prior experience with Plotly graphing library or Dash app technologies, in either open source or enterprise forms
  • Interest in data visualization or data science generally
  • Is willing to work in our Montr√©al headquarters, or elsewhere in Canada

What We Can Offer You:

  • A way to put your skills to use enabling people around the world to better understand their data and make better decisions
  • Membership in an exciting and vigorous open-source ecosystem: most or all of what you will work on will be publicly available forever
  • Knowledge-sharing with smart, motivated colleagues and folks working at the most sophisticated companies in the world
  • Flexible work hours and generous paid time off
  • A promote-from-within philosophy
  • Health benefits
  • Company stock options

About Plotly: Plotly is a high-growth company that is transforming how people visualize data by helping Fortune 500 companies close the gap between Data Science and the rest of the organization. We started building our precedent-setting open-source software back in 2013, and since then we‚Äôve received over $30M in funding, including from grants such as ScaleAI and the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, to support our efforts. Plotly is primed to continue its path toward becoming the most downloaded, trusted framework for building AI, ML & data science web apps for the world‚Äôs leading companies.

At Plotly, you'll work alongside a diverse team of 50 first-class scientists, engineers, developers and builders that challenge the status quo and set the bar high. We encourage each member of our team to explore and expand their skill sets on a continuous basis, to approach every problem with curiosity and an open-mind. Together, we make it possible for people everywhere to share data, facts and information. We believe that knowledge is built through sharing and accessibility, through dialog and debate on a level playing field. Come help us democratize the data so that we can deliver knowledge.¬†

Plotly is an equal-opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. If you require any accommodations, please let us know in advance.

We‚Äôre looking forward to getting to know you!

title: Open source community builder
description:
Ready to put your passion for open source and your talent for connecting people to the test? Come help us build our open source community centered around VoIP technology!

We are looking for a colleague well-versed in networking, community building, and project management to come join our team and help us build our newest endeavor, an open source community. At Devhouse Spindle, we recognize the value and importance of open source software. Whether it‚Äôs using existing projects in our VoIP platform VoIPGRID, or open sourcing parts of our Vialer Webphone, we incorporate open source software whenever we can. These efforts led us to notice that the VoIP open source scene is very fragmented. There are various projects and companies working to further open source VoIP technology, but nothing bringing them together. With that in mind, we set out to build the Open VoIP Alliance, a community of projects and companies working together to progress the development of VoIP technology.

As our new colleague, you would work to build the structure of the community, as well as build the momentum for it. One of your first duties will be to see what we have already built and come up with creative ways to further our ideas. You would also be our spokesperson and networker, so having experience with that as well as knowledge of the best ways to get others involved is a must. You will also take part in planning and organizing hackathons, meetups, workshops and the like to keep our community active. As an individual, you are organized and enthusiastic. You don‚Äôt mind being the person that gets things running and pulls the rest of the team along, but you do value communicating and collaborating with the team and the community. For this role, English is the main communication language, so you must be comfortable communicating in English regularly. Other languages are welcome, but not required.

Your professional profile

You:

  • Have a great command of English, our working language
  • Have experience with community building
  • Have experience working in open source communities
  • Have experience with project management
  • Have your own opinions on running a community

Bonus points if you:

  • Have experience with VoIP technology

About Spindle

Devhouse Spindle is a growing and ever-changing organization on a mission to connect the world using open and free communication. With almost 60 colleagues, we develop the tools that make this possible such as VoIPGRID, our award winning telefony platform. Alongside that we develop an app (both Android and iOS versions), Webphone, and a browser plugin which allow you to use the VoIP platform wherever you are.

Next to the tools we develop, we also connect people through the foundation, 48percent.org and the open source community, the Open VoIP Alliance. Spindle is located in Groningen, a beautiful city known for its innovation and the second fastest growing tech city in the Netherlands.

Working at Spindle

If you look around the office, you‚Äôll notice we do things a bit different around here:

  • We organize ourselves using a system called Holacracy. We believe every colleague is able to contribute to the organization rather than relying on a traditional hierarchy. Having no managers comes with extra responsibility to take ownership of your work and set priorities that help to further the organization.
  • We work with a ‚Äúbuild, measure, learn‚Äù mentality and open mindset. We recognize that not everything you do is going to work right away. We praise experimentation and reward trying something new, even if the lesson is to not try it again.
  • We have an open and transparent salary system. Every colleague is placed in the pathway and a level best fitting their education, experience, and visible behavior. We encourage growth and have clear guidelines and expectations for doing so.
  • We are a diverse and inclusive team of international coworkers. We value the differences that each person brings to the table and think that it's those differences that strengthen our organization.
  • We strongly believe in open source. We show this by open sourcing our code when possible, using other open source projects for our VoIP platform, contributing to projects, and we have even started the Open VoIP Alliance to encourage collaboration when it comes to VoIP open source software.

What we offer

  • A relaxed and welcoming culture with celebrations, events, and trips
  • A competitive salary and good pension benefits
  • An annual study budget and study days for personal and professional growth
  • Two weeks leave when welcoming a new member to the family
  • Other benefits that contribute to your health, well-being, and work/life balance

Want to know more about this job, the employee benefits, or Spindle? Don‚Äôt hesitate to contact Dick on +31508009078 or teamup@wearespindle.com.

Please note that we are currently not hiring for remote work. You need to have an EU Working Permit (Orientation Year Visa not included) in order to be applicable for this position.
how_to_apply:
Online, at this address: https://jobs.wearespindle.com/open-source-community-builder

Or email us at teamup@wearespindle.com, or call us on +31508009078.

Deshalb f√∂rdern wir Ihre Kompetenz, Ihre Ideen und Ihr Engagement f√ºr Projekte, die die Welt verbessern. Gehen Sie mit uns Ihren Weg in die Zukunft.

  • Qualit√§tssicherung: Sie bewerten Architekturen regelm√§√üig gem√§√ü Architektur- und SRC-Konformit√§t (Security, Risk, Compliance) sowie Betriebsstabilit√§t und binden die verantworteten Architekturbereiche ein. Weiterhin stellen Sie die Integration fachlicher und SRC-Anforderungen in den jeweiligen Ausschnitten der KfW IT-Gesamtarchitektur sicher.

Das bringen Sie mit

  • Mehrj√§hrige relevante Berufserfahrung in Anwendungsdesign & Methoden sowie im Architektur-Management und Kenntnisse der typischen IT-Prozesse, idealerweise im Kontext von Finanzinstituten
  • Fortgeschrittenes Wissen in Anwendungsentwicklung und Anwendungsbetrieb / ITILv3 sowie umfangreiches Wissen in IT-Strategie- und Prozessgestaltung
  • Praxiserfahrung vor allem mit Eigenentwicklungen im Java-Umfeld, speziell auch mit in der Cloud entwickelten Applikationen und den entsprechenden Technologie-Stacks und Konzepten (z.B. MicroServices, Docker, Kubernetes) sowie Konfiguration und Management von Cloud-Umgebungen und -Prozessen, idealerweise Microsoft Azure Cloud
  • Sie k√∂nnen fundierte Projekterfahrungen vorweisen, mit externen Dienstleistern souver√§n umgehen und kommunizieren sicher auf Deutsch und Englisch
  • Ausgepr√§gtes Analyseverm√∂gen und vernetztes, strategisches Denken, die Sie beim Finden kreativer L√∂sungen gewinnbringend einsetzen, sowie starke konzeptionelle F√§higkeiten, die Ihnen dabei helfen andere von Ihren L√∂sungen zu √ºberzeugen ‚ÄìSie k√∂nnen Architekturentscheidungen nicht nur geschickt vorbereiten und herbeif√ºhren, sondern auch bei der operativen Umsetzung helfen

Was wir bieten

  • Marktgerechte Verg√ºtung

¬∫ Bei uns erwartet Sie ein angemessenes Verg√ºtungspaket mit verm√∂genswirksamen Leistungen und Jobticket.

  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge

¬∫ Wir bauen auf Ihre Zukunft mit einer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge.

  • Vereinbarkeit von Familie & Beruf

¬∫ Wir unterst√ºtzen Sie mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice M√∂glichkeiten, 30 Tagen Urlaub, individuelle Teilzeitmodellen und Eltern-Kind-B√ºros.

  • Weiterentwicklung & Trainings

¬∫ Immer auf dem neusten Stand mit pers√∂nlichen und fachlichen Weiterentwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten.

  • Gelebte Vielfalt & Inklusion

¬∫ Vielf√§ltigkeit und Chancengleichheit sind f√ºr uns als Unterzeichner der Charta der Vielfalt gelebter Alltag.

  • Gesundheitsf√∂rderung

¬∫ Mit √ºber 30 Betriebssportgruppen bis hin zu Gesundheitskurs

Sie m√∂chten Verantwortung √ºbernehmen und gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft gestalten?

Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung als IT Solution Expert (w/m/d) Softwareentwicklung & Cloud-Applikationen √ºber das Bewerbungsformular!. Bei Fragen zur Position k√∂nnen Sie sich gerne an Herrn Burger unter der Nummer +49 (0) 69 7431-8222 wenden
